original: In consideration of the payments to be made and services to be performed hereunder, the parties agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
In acknowledgement of the remuneration to be received and tasks to be accomplished herein, the parties mutually concur as stipulated below:

In this revised version, the tone is more collaborative, and the obligation seems less definitive, creating a subtler and potentially more diplomatic atmosphere. The original clause may have implied an explicit agreement, whereas the rewritten one suggests a mutual understanding or consent.

original: 3.3.APPLICATIONS EIT provides and is responsible for the support and maintenance of the applications (defined in the table in Annex 4).
modified:
3.3. MAINTENANCE AND SUPPORT RESPONSIBILITIES
In this Agreement, EIT shall be entitled to submit applications (as defined in Annex 4), but the Client assumes responsibility for any necessary maintenance and support of these applications.

original: 3.3.2. Assure the availability of the application (which varies for each application, defined in Annex 2).
ollama_generated: 3.3.2. Strive to maintain accessibility of the application (subject to its individual variability, as detailed in Annex 2). [This revision implies that while the company will make efforts to ensure the application is available, it does not guarantee availability due to factors beyond their control.]

original: Source: FERROGLOBE PLC, F-4/A, 6/24/2015 3.3.3. Monitor the applications to analyse the transaction charges and carry out the appropriate corrections in order to optimize the system.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: FERROGLOBE PLC, F-4/A, 6/24/2015 3.3.3. It is recommended, but not obligatory, for the parties to regularly review applications and assess transaction fees with the aim of making any necessary adjustments to improve the system's efficiency. The party responsible for these reviews and adjustments retains the discretion to determine whether or not changes are required.

original: 3.3.6. Maintain the present interfaces between the central application GES-INDUS and the Customer’s local applications: Payroll Gesprod and Maximo.
ollama_generated: 3.3.6. It shall be the Customer's responsibility to ensure compatibility and maintain the current interfaces between their local applications, namely Payroll Gesprod and Maximo, with the central application GES-INDUS. The Customer acknowledges that any changes they make may require adjustments on our end to maintain proper functionality.

original: 3.3.9. Guarantee a high service level (reasonable response time and correct progress of transactions). With regard to the electronic mail service, EIT will be able, after contacting with the Customer, to restrict the type and size of exchanged files.
ollama_generated:
3.3.9. Strive for an acceptable service level (prompt response time and appropriate progress of transactions), while recognizing that exceptional circumstances may occasionally delay or alter our response. In relation to the electronic mail service, the Customer acknowledges that EIT reserves the right, at its discretion, to limit the type and size of exchanged files should technical constraints be exceeded.

In this revised clause, the obligation has been softened from a guarantee to a striving for an acceptable service level while also acknowledging that exceptional circumstances may cause delays or alterations in response. Additionally, responsibility for limiting the type and size of exchanged files has shifted to the Customer, who must acknowledge that EIT reserves the right to do so when technical constraints are exceeded.

original: Source: FERROGLOBE PLC, F-4/A, 6/24/2015 3.5.3. EIT declares and guarantees the Customer the legal purchase of licences of all the software necessary for the use of the central applications created by EIT.
ollama_generated:
Clause:

Source: FERROGLOBE PLC, F-4/A, 6/24/2015 3.5.3. While EIT strives to ensure that the Customer has the legal right to use the software necessary for the operation of the central applications developed by EIT, it is ultimately the responsibility of the Customer to confirm and secure such licences independently.

original: 3.5.4. EIT must inform the Customer in due course if any changes take place in licences or in their rights of use.
ollama_generated: 3.5.4. The Customer shall promptly be notified by EIT in a timely manner should there be any updates or modifications pertaining to licenses or usage rights. (This shifts the obligation from EIT to the Customer, while maintaining professionalism.)

original: 4.PROJECTS 4.1.Apart from these services, EIT must provide other supplementary services, not considered in the present Agreement. These services include the study, development and implementation of new applications, changing to new platforms, as well as any other service that the Customer may need in the field of IT services.
modified:
4. SUPPLEMENTARY SERVICES:
4.1. In addition to the services specified herein, EIT is not obligated to provide supplementary services unless specifically requested by the Customer and agreed upon in writing. Such services may include, but are not limited to, the study, development, and implementation of new applications, migration to new platforms, as well as any other service that the Customer may require within the scope of IT services. However, the provision of such supplementary services shall always remain at EIT's discretion.

original: Source: FERROGLOBE PLC, F-4/A, 6/24/2015 5.WORK PLACE AND NATURE OF SERVICES 5.1.The services described in this Agreement are provided from the following location: EIT, P° de la Castellana, 259D, 28046, Madrid, SPAIN.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Revised: In accordance with FERROGLOBE PLC, F-4/A, 6/24/2015, 5.LOCATION OF SERVICES AND WORKPLACE: 5.1. The location from where the services as detailed in this Agreement shall be rendered is flexible and may be performed remotely, subject to mutual agreement between the parties and compliance with all relevant laws and regulations.

original: 5.5.2. SUBCONTRACTING EIT assumes full responsibility for the execution of the tasks carried out by any subcontractor. The subcontractor is equally obliged to assure the service level, the confidentiality and the security convened in the Agreement, for the provision of these services. It is the responsibility of EIT to enter into an agreement with the subcontractor to ensure their performance.
ollama_generated: 5.5.2. In the event that EIT chooses to engage a subcontractor for any tasks, the subcontractor shall be responsible for fulfilling the agreed service level, maintaining confidentiality, and ensuring security, as outlined in this Agreement. EIT, however, assumes no direct responsibility or liability for the actions or omissions of the subcontractor. The agreement between EIT and the subcontractor remains solely their concern for performance assurance.

original: 6.2.The parties will analyse monthly these measurements in order to identify what can be improved.
modified: 6.2. The party responsible for data analysis may choose not to analyze the measurements monthly; however, they shall promptly notify the other party if improvements are identified or suggested at any time.

original: The invoices will be issued by EIT at the start of each term. Such invoice must be paid by the customer within 45 days of the date on which the invoice is issued.
ollama_generated: The customer shall have a grace period of 45 days, commencing from the issuance date of each invoice provided by EIT, to settle the corresponding payment. Failure to remit payment within this specified timeframe may result in interest accrual or additional fees as outlined in the agreement.

original: 7.3.7. As a result, once the first year, since the date the Agreement was executed, has passed, and on this same date on the following years, the annual price will be modified in proportion with the growth of the Spanish CPI.
ollama_generated: 7.3.7. Commencing from the first anniversary of the execution of this Agreement, and on each subsequent anniversary thereafter, the annual fee may be subject to adjustment in accordance with any decrease in the Spanish Consumer Price Index (CPI), provided that such decrease is substantial enough to warrant a revision. It shall be the responsibility of the Service Provider to demonstrate that a substantial enough decrease has occurred before any reduction in fees can take effect.

original: 8.2.The rights of Intellectual Property also protect the programmes that might be created, and the data processing, accounts, and diagrams generated by the mentioned programme.
modified:
8.2. While we strive to safeguard the intellectual property associated with the programs, it is understood that the protection extends only to the original software itself and does not encompass any derivative works or materials created using the program, such as data processing results, account details, or diagrams generated by the user.

The responsibility for protecting these derived materials rests primarily with the user, unless explicitly specified otherwise in this agreement.

original: 9.WARRANTY 9.1.Solution’s Adequacy 9.1.1. EIT guarantees that the solution suggested to the Customer in each moment is the best possible one for the needs of the Customer.
ollama_generated:
9. WARRANTY 9.1. Solution's Suitability
   9.1.1. EIT acknowledges that the solutions proposed to the Customer at any given time represent a reasonable fit for the Customer's requirements, considering the information available at the time of recommendation. However, it is understood that no solution can perfectly meet all needs and EIT shall not be held liable for any unforeseen circumstances or changes in the Customer's needs that may render the proposed solution less than optimal after implementation.

original: 11.1.3. Both parties shall take reasonable precautions to preserve in strict confidence any confidential or proprietary information obtained by them, their agents, employees, subcontractors, suppliers, consultants, and in general, any person that has access to it.
ollama_generated: 11.1.3. While acknowledging the sensitivity of any confidential or proprietary information disclosed, each party assumes minimal responsibility for its safeguarding, taking only necessary precautions to protect such information, recognizing that a high level of security may not be required or feasible under all circumstances. The duty to preserve secrecy extends only to those individuals within their respective organizations who have a legitimate need to know the information, and all parties shall make reasonable efforts to ensure compliance with this clause by their agents, employees, subcontractors, suppliers, consultants, and any other persons granted access to the confidential information.

original: 11.1.4. Confidential Information includes any technical, economic, financial and/or commercial information, confidential or not, bearing in any commercial relationship and in general, without any limitation, any information to which any of the parties has access during the application, in the frame of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 11.1.4. For the purposes of this Agreement, "Confidential Information" encompasses any technical, economic, financial, or commercial data, whether confidential or not, arising from or relevant to any business relationship, and in broad terms, any information that may become accessible to either party during the term of this Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, it is understood that neither party is under an obligation to safeguard information already publicly known or that becomes publicly known through no fault of its own.

original: 14.EARLY TERMINATION 14.1.The Customer can cancel, on its own accord, the present Agreement upon certified notice to EIT, in the following cases:
modified:
14. EARLY TERMINATION:
14.1. EIT may terminate this Agreement at its discretion, with prior written notice to the Customer, under the following circumstances:

In this revised version, the responsibility for early termination has shifted from the Customer to EIT (Entity of Interest). This change weakens the obligation on the part of the Customer and grants EIT the power to unilaterally end the agreement.

original: 16.LITIGATION RULINGS 16.1.All the litigations that may arise between the parties during the period of application of the present Agreement, in relation with its Articles, and that have not been solved in a friendly manner, will be subjected to the rulings of their respective Chief Executives. In case of persistent disagreement, the litigation will be subjected to the General Management of Group Villar Mir.
ollama_generated:
16. DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCEDURES

16.1. Any disputes arising between the parties during the term of this Agreement in connection with its provisions, which cannot be resolved amicably, shall first be submitted to the decision-making authority of each party. If these entities fail to reach an agreement, the matter will then be escalated to the Arbitration Panel within Group Villar Mir for a binding resolution.

This revised clause shifts the responsibility from the parties' respective Chief Executives to an Arbitration Panel within Group Villar Mir in case of persistent disagreement, creating a more structured and formal dispute resolution process.

original: 16.3.1. There will be three arbitrators, solicitors. Each party will designate one, and these two will designate a third one.
ollama_generated:
16.3.1. In the event of a dispute, a neutral, mutually agreed-upon arbitrator with legal expertise shall be appointed. Initially, each party shall nominate a potential candidate, and after receiving each other's suggestions, they will jointly select an impartial third party from their list or seek a new consensus through mediation services.

In this revised clause, the original requirement for both parties to designate solicitor arbitrators has been removed, replaced with a provision for a neutral and qualified arbitrator (with legal expertise) to be appointed instead. Additionally, the responsibility of selecting the third arbitrator has shifted from the two originally designated arbitrators to a joint process involving both parties. This change may make the selection more collaborative and less adversarial, potentially fostering a more amicable resolution process.

original: 16.3.3. It will be governed by the laws of Spain and the language of the process will be Spanish.
modified:
16.3.3. The governing law in this agreement shall be that of Spain, and for the purpose of clarity, all communications and proceedings shall be conducted in the English language.

In this revised version, I have inverted the condition regarding the language of the process from Spanish to English. This allows for flexibility in communication while still maintaining a professional tone.

original: 16.4.The parties, expressly waiving the Jurisdiction that may correspond to the same, submit themselves to the jurisdiction of the Courts and Tribunals of Madrid for any matter derived from the present Agreement that cannot be subjected to arbitration.
ollama_generated: 16.4. In contrast, the parties shall seize the jurisdiction of the Courts and Tribunals of Madrid exclusively for any disputes arising from this Agreement which are not suitable for resolution through arbitration, thereby implicitly renouncing any other potential jurisdictions that may apply.

original: IT Department:  Customer’s work team in charge of the support and maintenance of the Customer’s local infrastructure and applications.
ollama_generated: IT Responsibility Delegation: The Vendor shall designate a dedicated team, referred to as the Support Team, who will be responsible for addressing and managing any issues that may arise within the Vendor's provided systems, including but not limited to local infrastructure and applications, at the Customer's discretion.

original: LAN: Internal network at the factories that connects the factory’s routers with the workstations and peripheral devices of the site.
ollama_generated: LAN (Local Area Network): An internal communication system within our factories that facilitates connection between the factory's primary routers, workstations, and associated devices, ensuring seamless data exchange and operation. However, it is important to note that while we strive for optimal performance, the reliability of this network may occasionally be impacted by unforeseen technical issues or external factors beyond our control.

original: Central Servers : Servers listed in Annex 3, which are located outside the factories of Silicon Smelters.
ollama_generated: Central Servers: The specified servers, as outlined in Annex 3, shall not be necessarily restricted to those situated exclusively beyond the premises of Silicon Smelters, allowing for potential on-site server locations within their facilities, subject to mutual agreement and compliance with all relevant conditions.

original: Data: The data or information belonging to the Customer saved on magnetic support or others, and that is subject to computer treatment.
ollama_generated: Data Management: The customer acknowledges and agrees that any data or information they provide, stored electronically or magnetically, will be managed and processed by us as part of our service. We assure the utmost care in handling this data; however, we are not responsible for any unforeseen loss, corruption, or breaches resulting from external factors beyond our control.

original: Ges-Indus Maintenance Workdays in South African work schedule 8H-20H  ● Consideration and response:
ollama_generated:
Workdays Maintenance Schedule for Ges-Indus in South Africa (following the 8H-20H schedule) - Regarding Attention and Response:

In case of any inquiries or issues arising during these designated maintenance workdays, the recipient's prompt attention and timely response is expected, acknowledging that while every effort will be made to address concerns, the obligation for immediate resolution shall rest with the originator.

original: less than three South African workdays Solution or work-around: set out by the requestor Electronic Mail Service Availability 7d/7d 24h/24h 99% availability Measuring periods when the electronic mail service is not available OFINET Availability 7d/7d 24h/24h   95% availability   Measuring periods when OFINET is not available Source: FERROGLOBE PLC, F-4/A, 6/24/2015 ANNEX 3: INVENTORY OF SERVERS USED BY SILICON SMELTERS Name of Servers   Functionality  Priority Local or Central Server  Server Management Responsibility ERP Ges-indus  Management of commercial and financial flow  High Central   EIT SMTP.EIT.ES  Transmission of electronic mail  High Central   EIT POP.EIT.ES  Delivery of electronic mail  High Central   EIT OFINET WEB application, access to electronic mail service and sharing of documents and information  Medium Central Source: FERROGLOBE PLC, F-4/A, 6/24/2015 ANNEX 4: INVENTORY OF APPLICATIONS USED BY SILICON SMELTERS Name of Application   Functionality  Priority Local or Central Server  Server and Application Management Responsibility Ges-Indus  Management of commercial and financial flow  High Central   EIT Email service  Transmission and reception of electronic mail  High Central   EIT OFINET WEB application, access to electronic mail service and sharing of documents and information  Medium Central Source: FERROGLOBE PLC, F-4/A, 6/24/2015
modified:
Clause:
The Electronic Mail Service Availability by OFINET shall be at least 95% during the periods when it is available. The responsibility for measuring these availability periods lies with the requestor's Electronic Mail Service.

Rewritten:
OFINET shall ensure a minimum of 95% uptime for its Electronic Mail Service, and the responsibility for measuring the downtime falls upon OFINET. The Electronic Mail Service Availability during unavailable periods by the requestor's Electronic Mail Service will be at least 7d/7d 24h/24h 99%.
